citeinfo.origin: Digital Social Science Center (DSSC), Columbia University Libraries
citeinfo.title: Beijing, 1988

descript.abstract: This is a scanned version of the 1988 paper map set entitled: Beijing, published by the United States Central Intelligence Agency. This map consists of six sheets, the online linkage file provides a polygon layer that serves an index for the six sheets. To download the map sheets using this index in ArcMap, add the layer, open the layer properties dialog, select the display tab, and check the "support hyperlinks using field" box while selecting the URL field in the dropdown menu. Then use the hyperlinks tool to select the polygon representing the desired tile. These map sheets were scanned at 300 dots per inch and are in the TIFF format.
descript.purpose: Scanned maps may be used for a variety of purposes. These images may be used in a GIS.
descript.supplinf: 1 map on 6 sheets : col. ; sheets 95 x 79 cm. Scale 1:15,000 (E 116^(0)08'52"--E 116^(0)32'07"/N 40^(0)3'?4"'--N 39^(0)49?'3"). English and romanized Chinese (Pinyin). Shipping list no.: 88-304-P (Sheets 1,4); 88-309-P (Sheets 2-3); 88-339-P (Sheet 5); 88-343-P (Sheet 6). Inset: Relief map of Beijing. Scale 1:250,000. All sheets include index to adjoining sheets. Indexes and glossaries on verso. 800897 3-88 -- 800902 4-88 (Sheets 1-6).

cntorgp.cntorg: Research Data Services (RDS), Columbia University Libraries

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.2.1350

dataqual.logic: The raster image is a faithfully reproduced digital image of the original source map. Some differences may be detected between the source graphic used and the raster image due to the RGB values assigned that particular color. The intent is to recreate those colors as near as possible.
dataqual.complete: Data completeness for digitized paper map files reflect the content of the source graphic.

procstep.procdesc: Original map was scanned at 300 dpi and saved in .tiff format with Colortrac5480 Scanner
